subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Cardiff reached the F.A. Cup final for the first time since 1927, beating Barnsley, 1-0, at Wembley on Joe Ledley’s ninth-minute goal. Cardiff, which plays in Britain’s second-tier League Championship, will face the Premier League club Portsmouth in the final on May 17. On Saturday, Portsmouth edged another Championship club, West Bromwich Albion, 1-0. Cardiff has won the F.A. Cup once — in 1927, when it defeated Arsenal, 1-0.
